main event: Two unidentified aircraft were detected by radar and visually confirmed near Las Cruces Air Force Station, New Mexico on February 7, 1957.
interesting points: The two objects exhibited erratic flight paths, sudden accelerations and decelerations, and performance characteristics beyond the capabilities of known aircraft.
The objects were detected by two separate and distinct radar systems at the Las Cruces Air Force Station.
The sighting was further confirmed by visual observation by the Air Defense Direction Officer and the crew of a T-33 interceptor aircraft.
Subsequent investigation revealed no evidence to indicate the sighting was a test or exercise involving known aircraft.
The objects maintained an indicated airspeed of approximately 1000 mph and maneuvered as a mated pair.
location: Las Cruces Air Force Station, New Mexico
witnesses: radar operators, Air Defense Direction Officer, T-33 interceptor crew
